net.opentsdb.auth

Class AllowAllAuthenticatingAuthorizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.opentsdb.auth.AllowAllAuthenticatingAuthorizer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Authentication, Authorization

    public class AllowAllAuthenticatingAuthorizer
extends Object
implements Authentication, Authorization
    The default authentication and authorization plugin. This plugin allows all users with no real authentication or authorization. By default, users are considered in the ADMINISTRATOR role and have all of the net.opentsdb.auth.Permissions
    Since:
    2.4.0
    Author:
    jonathan.creasy

      • initialize

        public void initialize(TSDB tsdb)
        Description copied from interface: Authentication
        Called by TSDB to initialize the plugin Implementations are responsible for setting up any IO they need as well as starting any required background threads. Note: Implementations should throw exceptions if they can't start up properly. The TSD will then shutdown so the operator can fix the problem. Please use IllegalArgumentException for configuration issues.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface Authentication
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface Authorization
        Parameters:
        tsdb - The parent TSDB object

      • shutdown

        public com.stumbleupon.async.Deferred<Object> shutdown()
        Description copied from interface: Authentication
        Called to gracefully shutdown the plugin. Implementations should close any IO they have open
        Specified by:
        shutdown in interface Authentication
        Specified by:
        shutdown in interface Authorization
        Returns:
        A deferred object that indicates the completion of the request. The Object has not special meaning and can be null (think of it as Deferred<Void>).

      • version

        public String version()
        Description copied from interface: Authentication
        Should return the version of this plugin in the format: MAJOR.MINOR.MAINT, e.g. 2.0.1. The MAJOR version should match the major version of OpenTSDB the plugin is meant to work with.
        Specified by:
        version in interface Authentication
        Specified by:
        version in interface Authorization
        Returns:
        A version string used to log the loaded version

      • collectStats

        public void collectStats(StatsCollector collector)
        Description copied from interface: Authentication
        Called by the TSD when a request for statistics collection has come in. The implementation may provide one or more statistics. If no statistics are available for the implementation, simply stub the method.
        Specified by:
        collectStats in interface Authentication
        Specified by:
        collectStats in interface Authorization
        Parameters:

      • authenticateTelnet

        public AuthState authenticateTelnet(org.jboss.netty.channel.Channel channel,
                                    String[] command)
        Description copied from interface: Authentication
        Authenticate Telnet connections, provides the first line of the incoming connection.

        NOTE: This method should not throw exceptions, rather return a state object with the AuthStatus.ERROR status.

        Specified by:
        authenticateTelnet in interface Authentication
        Parameters:
        channel - A non-null Netty channel to associate with the request.
        command - A non-null list of "words" from a Telnet style command (strings or numbers separated by spaces)
        Returns:
        A non-null AuthState object with a valid AuthStatus to evaluate for a successful or unsuccessful authentication.

      • authenticateHTTP

        public AuthState authenticateHTTP(org.jboss.netty.channel.Channel channel,
                                  org.jboss.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpRequest req)
        Description copied from interface: Authentication
        Authenticate HTTP connections, provides the HTTPRequest object for the incoming connection.

        NOTE: This method should not throw exceptions, rather return a state object with the AuthStatus.ERROR status.

        Specified by:
        authenticateHTTP in interface Authentication
        Parameters:
        channel - A non-null Netty channel to associate with the request.
        req - A non-null HTTP request.
        Returns:
        A non-null AuthState object with a valid AuthStatus to evaluate for a successful or unsuccessful authentication.

      • allowQuery

        public AuthState allowQuery(AuthState state,
                            TSQuery query)
        Description copied from interface: Authorization
        Determines if the user is allowed to execute the given query. The returned state contains a status code regarding whether or not the query is allowed. If the query IS allowed, the same user state passed as an argument maybe returned.
        Specified by:
        allowQuery in interface Authorization
        Parameters:
        state - A non-null auth state with the user and AuthStatus.SUCCESS.
        query - A non-null query.
        Returns:
        An AuthState object with a valid AuthStatus to evaluate for permission.

      • allowQuery

        public AuthState allowQuery(AuthState state,
                            Query query)
        Description copied from interface: Authorization
        Determines if the user is allowed to execute the given query. The returned state contains a status code regarding whether or not the query is allowed. If the query IS allowed, the same user state passed as an argument maybe returned.
        Specified by:
        allowQuery in interface Authorization
        Parameters:
        state - A non-null auth state with the user and AuthStatus.SUCCESS.
        query - A non-null query.
        Returns:
        An AuthState object with a valid AuthStatus to evaluate for permission.
